item.title: Not emptied litter bin- looks like public domestic waste too….., 29th January

item.title: Car abandoned in residents car park by previous resident, 29th January
item.description:
Previous resident moved out of building over 3 years ago. Has been storing the car in the car park for over a year without it moving. The car has no MOT, is untaxed and is parked in someone elses private car parking space.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Laburnum Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter pick up St Francis Road SE22 8de, 29th January
item.description:
Extensive littering at dog kennel road end of st Francis road needs to be cleaned by Southwark cleaning team. Litter was less than 5 days ago cleaned by local residents as Southwark cleaning team are not doing frequent enough cleaning. In less that 5 days extensive littering has taken place. Important note: please do not close this cleaning request until the litter has been cleaned from street as this has happened previously and litter has remained on the streets for weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, St. Francis Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 29th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped this outside my block of flats. It was part of a larger dump of bed equipment (mattress etc), which seems to have been cleared away, but not these headboards. They’ve been here for weeks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pelton Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and debris blocking the waterfall in Kelsey Park, 29th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle Blocking Footpath, 29th January
item.description:
Difficult for parents with strollers and individuals with mobility challenges to navigate this area. It forces pedestrians, including those with baby strollers to move onto the road in order to get past the front of the vehicle.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colthurst Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooded footpath in Alley behind Greenwich PostOffice, 29th January
item.description:
Posted yesterday but appears to have been removed (ref: 8785439) Flooded footpath... Recent building works have left this section of footpath without any effective drainage... A drainage system is required to prevent repeated flooding after rainfall, and slip-risk when frozen in cold weather...

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwich High Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
